non-negotiable.translation[0].definition: a non-negotiable principle or belief is one that you refuse to discuss or change
He emphasized that the government’s anti-nuclear position was non-negotiable.
a cheque, bond etc that is non-negotiable can only be exchanged for money by the person whose name is on it
non-negotiable.translation[1].definition: if a financial document such as a cheque is non-negotiable, it cannot be used by the person or organization receiving it to pay a third person or organization. CROSSED CHEQUEs are non-negotiable
if someone says that a demand, condition etc is non-negotiable, they mean that they are not willing to accept other suggestions, conditions etc
To think we can compromise on raising the fuel tax is wrong; it’s non-negotiable.
